de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.sensors

Class SensorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.sensors.SensorManager

  • public final class SensorManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The server manager keeps track of all sensors that are used by GarmentOS. New Sensors shall be registered here. This class also offers the ability to get any sensor according to its ID.
    Author:
    pfaehlfd, roehrdor

    • Field Summary

      protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Sensor> sortByValues(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Sensor> map)
      Sort the Map by the sensor names so the order they will be returned in is alphabetical This function shall usually be called after inserting any new sensor into the map

    • Method Detail

      • sortByValues

        protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Sensor> sortByValues(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Sensor> map)
        Sort the Map by the sensor names so the order they will be returned in is alphabetical This function shall usually be called after inserting any new sensor into the map
        Parameters:
        map - the map to be sorted
        Returns:
        the sorted map

      • addNewSensor

        public static void addNewSensor(Sensor sensor)
        Add a new Sensor to GarmentOS. To call this function a Sensor object is required.
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor to add to the system

      • save

        public static void save()
        Save the current settings

      • getSensorNames

        public static java.lang.String[] getSensorNames()
        This functions returns an array containing all the sensor names that are known by GarmentOS. Note GarmentOS does not prohibit to give the same name to different sensors. To uniquely identify a sensor consider using the ID and not the name.
        Returns:
        a String array containing all the sensor names that are known by GarmentOS

      • getSensorByID

        public static Sensor getSensorByID(int id)
        Get the sensor that is registered with the given ID. If the ID is not known to GarmentOS null will be returned by this function.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to search for.
        Returns:
        the Sensor object for the ID or null if the ID is unknown

      • getAllSensors

        public static java.util.Collection<Sensor> getAllSensors()
        Return a collection with all the registered Sensors by GarmentOS.
        Returns:
        a collection containing all sensors known by GarmentOS

      • getAllSensors

        public static java.util.Collection<Sensor> getAllSensors(SensorType sensorType)
        Return a collection with all the registered Sensors with thge given sensorTypeby GarmentOS.
        Returns:
        a collection containing all sensors with the given SensorType known by GarmentOS

      • removeSensor

        public static void removeSensor(int id)
        Remove the sensor with the given sensor id. If the sensor id is not found nothing will happen
        Parameters:
        id - the sensor id to be removed
